title: 820-00165 sensor issues
message:
Board came in with liquid damage and a short, after fixing the short board now works, but fans start to run fast after a few minutes of use, the Mac is not slow its just the fans that are loud. I checked the temperature of CPU etc. with MacFanControl and they all seem fine, so I am inclined that this is a sensor issue.

I tested this board on another Mac that has no issues and the problem is the same.

Any pointers on how to check sensors and see what it could be?

title: 820-00165 sensor issues
message:
So you tried same MLB with good LIO flex/board and good trackpad flex/board?

Did you also try it with another LCD assembly?
If not, disconnect webcam and test again.

title: 820-00165 sensor issues
message: The only thing that I put on the good known housing was the MLB all other components are fine as that other MacBook has no issues and yes that includes good trackpad flex/board and screen.

title: 820-00165 sensor issues
message:
Instal HWMonitor, I think it shows more information.
Check current sensors too, apart of temps.

title: 820-00165 sensor issues
message: Thanks, Memory Bank A1 is showing 128c, not sure what to look at but I will check the board again.

title: 820-00165 sensor issues
message: Those look clean, around the smc there are similar sensors, I removed  those and resoldered them but no luck

title: 820-00165 sensor issues
message:
Did you check traces continuity???
These sensors are far away of U5800...
